subject: Leadership
title: Leading Through Change
description: A 60-second lesson on Leading Through Change.

hook.text: A company announces a strategic shift. Half the team resists. Productivity drops. Change is the right call but it hurts.

buildup.text: Kotter's model identifies eight steps for leading change, starting with urgency and building a guiding coalition.

discovery.text: 70% of change initiatives fail. The common thread: leaders focus on the plan and forget the people impacted by it.

twist.text: Resistance isn't irrational. People fear lossâ€”of status, routine, or identity. Addressing fear beats logic every time.

climax.text: Win hearts first: explain the why, involve people early, celebrate small wins, and never underestimate emotional impact.

punchline.text: Change fails when leaders change the plan but not the culture.

quiz.question: Why do most change initiatives fail?
options: Leaders focus on the plan and forget the people
Change is impossible in large organizations
